__e: Mr. Avery sure is a gentleman of elegant taste, ain't he?
It's good thing Avery's the kind of man who enjoys playing games.
I remember, you won the Avery Scholarship and Gilbert Blythe won the gold medal.
I don't believe in Brother Avery. I believe in something else-- something that might hurt you a great deal.
I'm afraid Mr. Avery hasn't faith in the unspoiled instincts of childhood.
I'm sorry, Mr Avery, we don't stock what you're looking for.
Well, at least Avery was kind enough not to put a guard on us.
